rev.comment: /* Politics and secular symbolism */ no rationale for this use
rev.diff:
Line 53: Line 53:
*After Alexander's victory over the Indian king [[Porus]], the captured [[war elephants]] became a symbol of imperial power, used as an emblem of the [[Seleucid]] [[diadoch]] empire, e.g. on coins.
*After Alexander's victory over the Indian king [[Porus]], the captured [[war elephants]] became a symbol of imperial power, used as an emblem of the [[Seleucid]] [[diadoch]] empire, e.g. on coins.
*The elephant, and the [[white elephant]] (also a religious symbol of [[Gautama Buddha|Buddha]]) in particular, has often been used as a symbol of royal power and prestige in Asia; occurring on the flag of the kingdom Laos (three visible, supporting an umbrella, another symbol of royal power) till it became a republic in 1975, and other Indochinese and Thai realms had also displayed one or more white elephants.
*The elephant, and the [[white elephant]] (also a religious symbol of [[Gautama Buddha|Buddha]]) in particular, has often been used as a symbol of royal power and prestige in Asia; occurring on the flag of the kingdom Laos (three visible, supporting an umbrella, another symbol of royal power) till it became a republic in 1975, and other Indochinese and Thai realms had also displayed one or more white elephants.
â
[[Image:Republicanlogo.svg|150px|thumb|left|The US Republican Party's Elephant Logo]]
 
*The elephant is also the symbol for the [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican Party]] of the United States, originating in an 1874 cartoon of an Asian elephant by [[Thomas Nast]] of ''[[Harper's Weekly]]'' (Nast also originated the [[donkey]] as the symbol of the [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic Party]]).
*The elephant is also the symbol for the [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican Party]] of the United States, originating in an 1874 cartoon of an Asian elephant by [[Thomas Nast]] of ''[[Harper's Weekly]]'' (Nast also originated the [[donkey]] as the symbol of the [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic Party]]).
[[Image:Keten Olifant.jpg|thumb|Collar of the Danish Order of the Elephant.]]
[[Image:Keten Olifant.jpg|thumb|Collar of the Danish Order of the Elephant.]]
